div1.head: Military Orders for Roger Post Ames, June 19, 1901
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, June 19, 1901.

1. Upon the recommendation of the Chief Paymaster of
the Department, Captain Otto Becker, Paymaster, U. S.
Army, will be relieved from duty at Matanzas, Cuba, upon
completion of payments of May 31, 1901, and he will then
proceed to this city for assignment to duty.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. Captain Roger P. Ames, Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Vol-
unteers, in addition to his other duties, will report to the
commanding officer, Santa Clara Battery, Havana, Cuba,
for duty at that post, relieving Contract Surgeon E. B.
Barnet, U. S. Army, and receipting to him for all public
property for which he is responsible.

3. In compliance with paragraph 5, Special Orders No.
138, current series, Headquarters of the Army, private
William M. Lightsey, transferred from troop C, 7th Cavalry,
to company A, 27th Infantry, will proceed to Fort McPher-
son, Georgia, reporting upon arrival to the commanding
officer for duty.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the neces-
sary transportation, and the Subsistence Department will
commute his rations, in advance, at the authorized rate, for
two (2) days, for that part of the journey to be performed
by rail, it being impracticable for this soldier to carry ra-
tions of any kind.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:
